personnel_requirements.description: CLIA personnel qualification requirements for laboratory developed tests

qualifications: MD, DO, or doctoral degree in chemical, physical, biological, or clinical laboratory science
Board certification in laboratory medicine or pathology
Minimum 4 years laboratory training or experience
responsibilities: Overall operation and administration of the laboratory
Selection of test methods and establishment of laboratory test performance
Verification of test performance prior to reporting results

qualifications: Doctoral degree in chemical, physical, biological, or clinical laboratory science
Minimum 2 years laboratory training or experience in high complexity testing
responsibilities: Technical supervision of high complexity test performance

qualifications: MD or DO with laboratory training or experience
Board certification in anatomic or clinical pathology
responsibilities: Consultation regarding diagnosis, treatment, and management of patient care
Correlation of test results with clinical findings

quality_control.description: Quality control requirements for laboratory developed tests under CLIA
daily_requirements: Two levels of control materials must be analyzed each day testing is performed
Control materials must be included with each batch of patient specimens
Control results must be within established limits before reporting patient results
control_materials: Must be appropriate for the test system
Must cover the reportable range of the test
Must be treated the same as patient specimens
documentation: Out-of-control situations must be documented with corrective action
Control charts should be maintained when applicable

method_validation.description: CLIA validation requirements for laboratory developed tests

validation_elements.requirement: Compare test results with a reference method or reference materials
validation_elements.acceptance_criteria: Results must correlate appropriately with expected values

validation_elements.requirement: Assess repeatability and reproducibility using appropriate specimens
validation_elements.acceptance_criteria: Coefficient of variation must be within acceptable limits

validation_elements.requirement: Establish the range of test values over which the laboratory can report accurate results
validation_elements.acceptance_criteria: Linear range must be established and verified

validation_elements.requirement: Establish appropriate reference intervals for the patient population served
validation_elements.acceptance_criteria: Intervals must be appropriate for demographics and methodology

requirements: Laboratories must participate in proficiency testing for regulated analytes
Unsuccessful proficiency testing requires corrective action
scoring_criteria: Must achieve acceptable performance on 4 out of 5 consecutive testing events
Two consecutive unsatisfactory scores require remedial action
Three consecutive failures may result in sanctions

record_contents: Date and time of specimen collection and testing
